SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Load Global and Storefront Data Separately

To simplify how you load custom settings, custom object records, and configuration settings, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now loads global data separately from storefront-specific data. The CC Admin | Global Settings | Data Loader page also now accepts a JSON static resource instead of an XML static resource for both global and storefront data. And, to help avoid any unwanted loss of partial storefront data, the Delete All button is no longer available on this page.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

How: If you’re upgrading from a previous version of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, you still go to CC Admin | Global Settings | Data Loader and click Upgrade.

When you install B2B Commerce for Visualforce for the first time in an org, go to CC Admin | Global Settings | Data Loader and click Initialize to load only the global data. Then, use the Load Storefront Data section to select one of the following data sets for a new storefront:

Demo data (coffee products) for the DefaultStore
A full set of data for a store named DefaultStore, with settings, objects, and configuration data for a fictional company called Capricorn Coffee. This data set includes records for products, categories, menus, accounts, promotions, and more, making it useful for training, demonstrations, and development.
Minimum data required to start building a storefront
A minimum set of data for a store named DefaultStore, with only the settings, objects, and configuration data required to load the storefront in the browser. This data set doesn’t have any predefined products, categories, menus, accounts, or promotions, making it a good starting point for defining your own storefront data.
Your custom storefront data
A static resource you upload to your org that contains your own storefront data in the required JSON format. You can also use this method to load partial data that supplements storefront data that you already loaded.

To remove storefront data from your org, use standard Salesforce data management tools, such as Salesforce Data Loader and Salesforce Developer Experience (DX).

title: Simplifying B2B Commerce for Visualforce Data Loading
